# How to perform user identity verification on a low budget

Ask Question

Asked 8 months ago

Modified 7 months ago

Viewed 224 times

This question shows research effort; it is useful and clear

-2 

This question does not show any research effort; it is unclear or not useful

Save this question.

Show activity on this post.

What is the least expensive or even free way to verify user's identity (KYC)
online using an API.

I looked at a few companies such trulioo.com or plaid.com but they are not
cheap. So far stripe.com has a good API and seems to be the most affordable
but if you know other options then please share.

  * identity
  * verification

Share

Share a link to this question

Copy linkCC BY-SA 4.0

Improve this question

Follow

Follow this question to receive notifications

asked Feb 21 at 1:58

JimskiJimski

83688 silver badges2424 bronze badges

Add a comment  |

##  1 Answer 1

Sorted by:  Reset to default

Highest score (default)  Trending (recent votes count more)  Date modified
(newest first)  Date created (oldest first)

This answer is useful

0

This answer is not useful

Save this answer.

Show activity on this post.

There are very few services that offer free identity verification however
there are some. If you need to verify only a few people per month then
https://withpersona.com/pricing can offer such a service.

If you need to verify a large number of people then Stripe offers relatively
inexpensive ID verification for checking ID numbers at $0.5.
https://stripe.com/identity#pricing

Also, be aware of the searches on Google for keywords such as "best identity
verification service" or "inexpensive identity verification" etc. These days
Google turned into a garbage dump of self promotion and online marketing so at
the top of your sarches you will see lists of ID services which are compiled
by online marketers with affiliate links, they are neither best nor cheapest!

# Are there any API's that can get the average price for a product?

Ask Question

Asked 7 months ago

Modified 7 months ago

Viewed 170 times

This question shows research effort; it is useful and clear

0

This question does not show any research effort; it is unclear or not useful

Save this question.

Show activity on this post.

I'm trying to make a website that needs to frequently change the price of the
product to the current market price so that I can order it and buy it for that
price. Basically I'm just wondering if there's any API out there that can take
the average of different website's prices for one product and give me an
average so I can get the general price of that product.

Does google shopping have something like this? Any help would be appreciated,
thanks!

  * javascript
  * api
  * e-commerce
  * price
  * google-shopping

Share a link to this question
